Package fr.sorbonne_u.cps.sensor_network.interfaces

General interfaces used by requests, clients and sensor nodes.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    BCM4JavaEndPointDescriptorI
    The interface BCM4JavaEndPointDescriptorI defines the methods that a BCM4Java end point descriptor must implement.
    ConnectionInfoI
    The interface ConnectionInfoI defines the methods giving access to the information required to connect to a sensor node as a client to make them execute requests on sensor values.
    EndPointDescriptorI
    The interface EndPointDescriptorI provides a common super-type for all implementations of connection protocols to connect sensor nodes.
    GeographicalZoneI
    The interface GeographicalZoneI declares the minimal methods that a geographical zone object must implement.
    NodeInfoI
    The interface NodeInfoI defines the methods for accessing all of the required information about a sensor node.
    PositionI
    The interface PositionI defines the methods for manipulating sensor node geographical positions.
    QueryResultI
    The interface QueryResultI defines the methods that the result of a query must implement.
    RequestContinuationI
    The interface RequestContinuationI defines the methods that a continuation object must implement.
    RequestI
    The interface RequestI defines the methods that provides access to the information about a request.
    RequestResultCI
    The component interface RequestResultCI is offered by client components and required by sensor node components to send the results of asynchronous requests back to the client that has sent the request to the sensor network.
    SensorDataI
    The interface SensorValueI defines the methods that a sensor data object must implement.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Direction
    The enumeration Direction defines the geographical directions used in the sensor network.

Package fr.sorbonne_u.cps.sensor_network.interfaces Description

General interfaces used by requests, clients and sensor nodes.

Licence

Copyright Jacques Malenfant, Sorbonne Universite.

Jacques.Malenfant@lip6.fr

This software is a computer program whose purpose is to implement a mock-up of a sensor network using components in BCM4Java.

This software is governed by the CeCILL-C license under French law and abiding by the rules of distribution of free software. You can use, modify and/ or redistribute the software under the terms of the CeCILL-C license as circulated by CEA, CNRS and INRIA at the following URL http://www.cecill.info.

As a counterpart to the access to the source code and rights to copy, modify and redistribute granted by the license, users are provided only with a limited warranty and the software's author, the holder of the economic rights, and the successive licensors have only limited liability.

In this respect, the user's attention is drawn to the risks associated with loading, using, modifying and/or developing or reproducing the software by the user in light of its specific status of free software, that may mean that it is complicated to manipulate, and that also therefore means that it is reserved for developers and experienced professionals having in-depth computer knowledge. Users are therefore encouraged to load and test the software's suitability as regards their requirements in conditions enabling the security of their systems and/or data to be ensured and, more generally, to use and operate it in the same conditions as regards security.

The fact that you are presently reading this means that you have had knowledge of the CeCILL-C license and that you accept its terms.

This package contains the interfaces provided for the sensor node project that are at the frontier between the request language (for its implementation and relationships with the sensor nodes), the clients and the sensor nodes.
